An 180° peel-off test of the Si electrode made with the newly developed polymer binders was conducted to determine the physical stability, that is the adhesive force, of PAU- g-PEG 1, which was designed to have both self-healing ability and ionic conductivity. The results were compared to that of pristine poly(acrylic acid) (PAA) with a molecular weight ( M
w = 100,000 g mol −1) similar to that of copolymers 1, and also with PAA- g-PEG 2, which has Li +-conductivity but no self-healing sites (Fig. 2a). All three electrodes had the same weight ratio (SiNP:Super P:binder = 6:2:2) and controlled thickness.
